hints.title: Causal Spacetime Tree (CST) Edges
hints.content:
93: :label: def-cst-edges
94: 
95: The **CST edge set** encodes temporal transitions between consecutive timesteps:
96: 
97: $$
98: E_{\text{CST}} := \{(n_{i,t}, n_{i,t+1}) : i \in \{1, \ldots, N\}, \, t \in \{0, \ldots, T-1\}, \, s(n_{i,t}) = 1\},
99: 
100: $$
101: 
102: where each edge represents the continuous evolution of a single walker from timestep $t$ to $t+1$ (alive walkers only).

hints.label: def-spinor-representation
hints.title: Spinor Representation
hints.content:
110: :label: def-spinor-representation
111: 
112: A **spinor** $\psi \in \mathbb{C}^{2^{[d/2]}}$ is a frame-covariant representation of a vector $v \in \mathbb{R}^d$ that transforms under the spinor representation of the rotation group $\text{SO}(d)$.
113: 
114: **Key property:** Under a rotation $R \in \text{SO}(d)$ of the vector:
115: 
116: $$
117: v \mapsto v' = Rv,
118: 
119: $$
120: 
121: the corresponding spinor transforms via:
122: 
123: $$
124: \psi \mapsto \psi' = S(R) \psi,
125: 
126: $$
127: 
128: where $S: \text{SO}(d) \to \text{Spin}(d)$ is the spinor representation (double cover of $\text{SO}(d)$).
129: 
130: **Advantages for the Fractal Set:**
131: 1. **Frame independence**: Spinors encode vectors without reference to a preferred basis
132: 2. **Geometric naturalness**: Spinor formalism is intrinsic to the manifold structure
133: 3. **Covariant derivatives**: Force and velocity transitions are geometric objects
134: 4. **Sign ambiguity**: Spinors have $\psi \equiv -\psi$, reflecting gauge freedom
135: 
136: **Practical encoding:** For computational purposes, we store both the vector $v \in \mathbb{R}^d$ and its spinor representation $\psi$, related by the Clifford algebra encoding:
137: 
138: $$
139: \psi = \text{exp}\left(\frac{1}{4} \sum_{j<k} \theta_{jk} \gamma_j \gamma_k\right) \psi_0
140: 
141: $$

hints.label: def-cst-edge-attributes
hints.title: CST Edge Spinor Attributes
hints.content:
151: :label: def-cst-edge-attributes
152: 
153: Each CST edge $(n_{i,t}, n_{i,t+1}) \in E_{\text{CST}}$ contains the following **spinor (frame-covariant)** quantities from the Adaptive Gas SDE:
154: 
155: **Identity:**
156: - $\text{walker\_id} = i$: Walker ID
157: - $\text{timestep} = t$: When transition occurred
158: 
159: **Velocity Spinors:**
160: - $\psi_{v,t} \in \mathbb{C}^{2^{[d/2]}}$: Velocity spinor at source timestep $t$
161: - $\psi_{v,t+1} \in \mathbb{C}^{2^{[d/2]}}$: Velocity spinor at target timestep $t+1$
162: - $\psi_{\Delta v} := \psi_{v,t+1} \ominus \psi_{v,t} \in \mathbb{C}^{2^{[d/2]}}$: Velocity increment spinor
163: 
164: **Position Displacement Spinor:**
165: - $\psi_{\Delta x} \in \mathbb{C}^{2^{[d/2]}}$: Position displacement spinor $x_{t+1} - x_t$
166: 
167: **Force Spinors (from Adaptive Gas SDE):**
168: 
169: From [../07_adaptative_gas.md](../07_adaptative_gas.md#def-hybrid-sde), the velocity evolution is:
170: 
171: $$
172: dv_i = \left[ \mathbf{F}_{\text{stable}}(x_i) + \mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}(x_i, S) + \mathbf{F}_{\text{viscous}}(x_i, S) - \gamma v_i \right] dt + \Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x_i, S) \circ dW_i
173: 
174: $$
175: 
176: We store spinor representations of each force component evaluated at timestep $t$:
177: 
178: **1. Stable Force Spinor:**
179: - $\psi_{\mathbf{F}_{\text{stable}}} \in \mathbb{C}^{2^{[d/2]}}$: Spinor encoding $\mathbf{F}_{\text{stable}}(x_t) = -\nabla U(x_t)$
180: 
181: **2. Adaptive Force Spinor:**
182: - $\psi_{\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}} \in \mathbb{C}^{2^{[d/2]}}$: Spinor encoding $\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}(x_t, S) = \epsilon_F \nabla_{x_i} V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho](x_t)$
183: 
184: **3. Viscous Force Spinor:**
185: - $\psi_{\mathbf{F}_{\text{viscous}}} \in \mathbb{C}^{2^{[d/2]}}$: Spinor encoding $\mathbf{F}_{\text{viscous}}(x_t, S) = \nu \sum_{j \neq i} K_\rho(x_i - x_j) (v_j - v_i)$
186: 
187: **4. Friction Force Spinor:**
188: - $\psi_{\mathbf{F}_{\text{friction}}} \in \mathbb{C}^{2^{[d/2]}}$: Spinor encoding $-\gamma v_t$
189: 
190: **5. Total Drift Spinor:**
191: - $\psi_{\mathbf{F}_{\text{total}}} := \psi_{\mathbf{F}_{\text{stable}}} \oplus \psi_{\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}} \oplus \psi_{\mathbf{F}_{\text{viscous}}} \oplus \psi_{\mathbf{F}_{\text{friction}}} \in \mathbb{C}^{2^{[d/2]}}$
192: 
193: **Diffusion Tensor Spinor:**
194: - $\psi_{\Sigma_{\text{reg}}} \in \mathbb{C}^{2^{[d/2]} \times 2^{[d/2]}}$: Spinor tensor encoding $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x_t, S) = (H_i(S) + \epsilon_\Sigma I)^{-1/2}$
195: 
196: **Stochastic Increment Spinor:**
197: - $\psi_{\text{noise}} \in \mathbb{C}^{2^{[d/2]}}$: Spinor encoding the Stratonovich increment $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x_t, S) \circ dW_t$
198: 
199: **Gradient Spinors:**
200: - $\psi_{\nabla U} \in \mathbb{C}^{2^{[d/2]}}$: Spinor of potential gradient $\nabla U(x_t)$
201: - $\psi_{\nabla \Phi} \in \mathbb{C}^{2^{[d/2]}}$: Spinor of fitness gradient $\nabla \Phi(x_t)$
202: - $\psi_{\nabla V_{\text{fit}}} \in \mathbb{C}^{2^{[d/2]}}$: Spinor of fitness potential gradient $\nabla V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho](x_t)$
203: 
204: **Derived Scalar Quantities:**
205: - $\|\Delta v\| = |\psi_{\Delta v}| \in \mathbb{R}_{\geq 0}$: Magnitude of velocity change
